alert.note: Alert for Lapeer (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 3:01AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Lapeer. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen from earlier thunderstorms with heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts will remain below 0.5 inches early this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lapeer, Imlay City, Almont, Brown City, North Branch, Columbiaville, Hadley, Dryden, Metamora, Otter Lake, Lum, Attica, Burnside, Elba, Kings Mill, Thornville and Goodland Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
